reasoning: Mixed histological type of breast cancer combining invasive ductal (70-80% of cases) and invasive lobular (10-15% of cases) carcinoma. Global breast cancer incidence from GLOBOCAN 2005 is ~45 per 100k women; estimated this specific histological combination at ~32.5 per 100k based on histological distribution patterns.
source: GLOBOCAN 2005 (IARC), histological distribution from international cancer registries

reasoning: Treatment-resistant or refractory Hodgkin lymphoma (primary refractory and early relapse cases). Global Hodgkin lymphoma incidence from GLOBOCAN 2005 is ~3 per 100k; refractory cases comprise approximately 10-20% of newly diagnosed cases, estimated at ~0.48 per 100k. Limited specific epidemiological data on refractory subtype.
source: GLOBOCAN 2005 (IARC); refractory rate estimates from lymphoma treatment outcome studies

reasoning: Highly specific disease entity combining age restriction (childhood, typically <18 years) with treatment-resistance. Childhood Hodgkin lymphoma incidence is ~0.5-1 per 100k children globally, with refractory cases in this pediatric population estimated at <0.1 per 100k overall population. Extremely limited epidemiological data specific to this subset.

Acute viral infectious disease with high incidence globally. Estimated incidence of ~2850 per 100k person-years based on WHO surveillance data and epidemiological studies of viral gastroenteritis. Significant geographic and seasonal variation; estimates include rotavirus, norovirus, and enteroviruses. Incidence varies substantially by age (much higher in children <5 years) and region.
source: WHO Global Burden of Disease estimates; multiple epidemiological studies from developed and developing countries

reasoning: RP62 is a specific genetic form of retinitis pigmentosa caused by mutations in a particular gene locus. Overall retinitis pigmentosa prevalence is ~1-2 per 100k population globally; RP62 represents one of numerous genetic subtypes (>90 genes identified). Estimated prevalence of RP62 subtype at ~0.15 per 100k based on relative rarity of this specific locus. Incidence data not well-defined for inherited retinal dystrophies; prevalence metric more appropriate.
